content:
I can't be sure on the mailnews.default_view_flags to 64. I use a value of 0. Not that 64 may be wrong; it's just that I don't understand its documentation, Regardless, here are steps to fix those folders that existed prior to change: To set many *existing* folders, follow these steps: (I creates a crude video that walks through the steps at 

   https://davidkirk.org/SettingDefaultFolderView.mp4  that demonstrates the following steps: 
   First, highlight a folder that you have set to unthreaded	    In the Message List view, in the column header, on the far right, open the options button that shows         context menu. :    At the very bottom is the option:    -> "Apply current view to..."    -> "Folder and its children..."    -> Hover over an account    -> In the next menu don't select a folder. Instead select the account name itself.

content: First, you are not causing any problems. This forum is here to support all users. Here is a fix: - exit thunderbird - locate the prefs.js and copy it to a safe location (just being safety-conscious.) - open prefs.js in a text editor, such as notepad. Be CAREFUL! - locate the entry in the file and carefully overtype back to -1.0 and save the file. - restart Thunderbird

content:
If your problem persists, please post a screen shot.

We have determined that some users somehow have a non-default value for hidden preferences ...

Check the Config Editor for this settings:

  • Settings > General
  • scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button

It opens in a new tab

  • In top search type: pixels
  • look for this line : layout.css.devPixelsPerPx
  • default is a negative number -1.0

It should not be in bold text, if bold text then it has been altered.

  • If you have anything else in that setting use the arrow icon on far right - click on it and the default is reset.

Another value to check is mail.uifontsize, what value do you see?

Please post your results
creator: wsmwk

content:
Come dicevo sopra, se l'URL cambia ogni volta non c'è modo di risolvere il problema. Thunderbird si ricorda che il file è aperto e si ricorda anche la sua posizione sul server, solo che nel frattempo il server quel file lo ha eliminato.

L'unica soluzione parziale è salvare il file sul disco locale.

content:
Per quel che vedo potrebbe dipende dal fatto che la casella email genera un indirizzo temporaneo per l'allegato. Quando chiudi la sessione quella URL viene dismessa e se apri nuovamente l'allegato ne viene generata una nuova. Puoi verificarlo? In pratica devi controllare se l'indirizzo che inizia per imap:// cambia

Se è così, non credo che ci sia soluzione.

creator: wsmwk

content: If the old PC is still available, the easiest solution would be to copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird from old PC and paste into same location on new PC. Do that when TB is not running on either PC. Then start TB on new PC and all should be there. Doing this copies not just the profile, but the profiles.ini that explicitly identifies the profile.
creator: davidsk

content:
When you add a contact by clicking the contact in the Header Pane of a message, it defaults to adding it to Personal Address Book. If you click again, choose Edit Contact and specify which address book to store it.

If you already have contacts in address books and wish to copy them to other books, the easiest way is to open Address Book, select the contact(s) in the right pane, then add it to another book by drag and drop, while holding Ctrl, onto the target book icon in the left pane. If Ctrl is not pressed, the contact is moved, not copied.
creator: sfhowes
